title.narrative: CAPACITY BUILDING / TECHNOLOGY TRANSFER AND PROVISION OF BASIC EQUIPMENT, ENTREPRENEURSHIP AND BDS FOR EAST AFRICAN SME’S

description.narrative: 135 number training on the bamboo value chain; 30 training on entrepreneurship; 3 CIDCA/MOFCOM training; 4 curricula developed. 5000 people trained. During the year 1, the programme organized 41skill development trainings, 8 entrepreneurship training and provided tools and equipment to 16 enterprises to improve the quality and quantity of production. The programme trained 1368 (847M/521F) beneficiaries

During the quarter (October – December 2021) organized 16 Nos of technical and capacity building training for 319 (169M/150F) beneficiaries on diversified products in value chains, i.e., bamboo furniture, jewelry, bamboo container, bamboo baskets, and bamboo bio-plastic products. One entrepreneurship and business development services(BDS) training were organized for 30(7M/23F) beneficiaries. Additional tools and equipment were supported to 9 enterprises to enhance the efficiency of the enterprises to produce quality bamboo products to participate in domestic markets. Technical Vocational Education Training(TVET) course curriculum for level-1 and level-2 has been developed, including Teaching Training, Learning Materials (TTLM) in partnership with the Ethiopian TVET institute; 4 curriculums are in progress with TVET- CDACC in Kenya and two curriculums on certificate and diploma on bamboo cultivation and resource utilization(BCRU) has been initiated in partnership with Nyabyeya Forestry College in Uganda.

Organized 21 skill training for 588 (325M/263F) entrepreneurs and industry workers (overall program conducted 86 training (63.70%) for 2314(1287M/1027F) beneficiaries against the indicators of 135 training/5000 beneficiaries; conducted 2Nos of entrepreneurship and business development training for 65(34M/31F) beneficiaries(overall program conducted 11 training (33.33%) against the indicators of 30 courses; and 13 enterprises supported with tools and fixtures to enhance SME efficiency (an overall program supported 38 (42.33%) enterprises against the indicators of 90 training); and 3 online training courses organized in collaboration with ICBR; NFGA; Zhejiang A&F University and Yunnan Academy of Forestry and Grassland on bamboo standards; bamboo cluster & multi- supply chain; and management of Sympodial bamboo for 197(149M/48F) beneficiaries (overall program progress 3 CIDCA/MoFCOM funded ToT training programs in China / East Africa). Design and development of TVET bamboo courses in Kenya with TVET-CDACC have been initiated. A similar initiative has been taken with Nyabyeya Forestry College, Masindi, Uganda.

activity-date.narrative: The programme organized a total of 41 technical skill development training for SME entrepreneurs and industry workers benefiting 1247 (782M/465F) and eight (8) training on entrepreneurship and business developments were provided for 121 (65M/56F). Tools and equipment were provided to 16 enterprises for improving the product quality and enhance production efficiency. The preparatory works for the development of the TVET course curriculum in Kenya (TVET-CDACC) and Uganda (Mekerere University) is in progress. Overall, the program-built capacity of 1368 (847M/521F)beneficiaries, accounting for 27 per cent of the overall programme target.
